result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Saul E Madrigal

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM case called. Judge Bill Stewart via video for Judge Annette Barna.  Defendant Saul E Madrigal appeared by phone.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier appeared by video for Saul E Madrigal.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives reading of Information. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Information. Court finds the plea is voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made. 
Court withholds a finding of Guilt and allows defendant to enter into the 18 month DAGP agreement with the State. 
Parties stipulate to remove compliance with pretrial monitoring from the signature bond. State to file a stipulation. No new bond is needed to be drafted.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 1, 2024 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on April 1, 2024 at 09:30 am.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement (DAGP) - Signed
of Personal Appearance
Arraignment on September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
